snippet: The Federal Trade Commission fined Spokeo $800,000, contending that it violated federal law in how it compiled and sold people’s personal information on its Web site.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission fines data collection company Spokeo $800,000, claiming that it violated federal law in how it compiled and sold people's personal information for use by potential employers to screen job applicants on its Web site; action is the FTC's first case addressing the sale of Internet and social media data for use in employment screening.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission fined Spokeo $800,000, contending that it violated federal law in how it compiled and sold people’s personal information on its Web site.

headline.seo: Spokeo Is Penalized by F.T.C. in Sale of Personal Data
headline.main: U.S. Penalizes Online Company in Sale of Personal Data
headline.print_headline: U.S. Penalizes Online Company in Sale of Personal Data
